properties.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued February 19 at 12:05PM EST until February 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 6 to 10 inches in the most persistent lake snows. Snowfall
rates may reach 1 to 2 inches per hour at times from late this
evening through daybreak on Thursday.

* WHERE...Wayne, Northern Cayuga, and Oswego counties. The
greatest snow amounts are expected to focus across northern
Wayne, Northern Cayuga, and southern Oswego counties.

* WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult at times. The hazardous
conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute.
properties.instruction:
The heaviest snow will fall in very narrow bands. If traveling, be
prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities.
Visibilities will be sharply reduced to less than one-half mile
during the heaviest snow.

Submit snow reports through our website or social media.

NWSheadline: LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST THURSDAY
HazardType: Heavy Lake Effect Snow, Lake Effect Snow
